Legal_Issue: Whether the RAD erred in concluding that a viable internal flight alternative existed in Dhaka
Credibility_Assessment: Threat from local persecutors not credible due to limited resources and lack of interest outside Habiganj
Evidence_Type: Family's wealth, location-based threat assessment, conditions in Dhaka
Key_Factor_in_Determination: No serious possibility of persecution in Dhaka; relocation feasible despite hardships
Regulation_Cited: IRPA sections related to refugee determination and IFA
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness and defensibility under the law
Application_Factor: Feasibility of relocation based on financial means and security conditions
Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of viable internal flight alternative
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IFA test: no serious possibility of persecution and not unreasonable conditions for relocation
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible threat in Dhaka; claim based solely on property rights not valid under IRPA
Evidentiary_Issues: Credibility of persecution threat outside original region
Procedural_Fairness: Process followed according to administrative standards
Credibility_Issues: Low credibility assigned to ongoing threat in Dhaka
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to RADâ€™s IFA conclusion on reasonableness grounds
Jurisdictional_Focus: Bangladesh (Habiganj and Dhaka), Canada (refugee determination system)
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review in judicial review of RAD decisions
